intro: Phoebe impressa, commonly known as the glossy phoebe, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its broad, dark green leaves that are often glossy and slightly革质 (leathery) in texture. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments. Phoebe impressa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to provide dense, evergreen coverage.
